content: Hi @T-compiler/meeting; the triage meeting will start in 23 minutes
WG-prioritization has done pre-triage in #t-compiler/wg-prioritization/alerts
@WG-prioritization has prepared the meeting agenda
We will have checkins from WG-mir-opt and WG-polonius
@oli it was unclear to me if you were going to fill something now or not
Nope, sorry, will do it for next week

hum ... test test
is the meeting starting or is it me I am not receiving messages?
at this point I don't think it will happen
so, it looks like the meeting won't happen today
I'll just throw a question if someone is here. Looking at the agenda, any comments to share about any issue or anything else?
feel free to reply here
(so we dont forget for the next time)
(Sorry for missing the meeting everyone. I should have found a replacement to run it when I realized I would be absent; it was relatively last minute change in plan for me)

@pnkfelix @Wesley Wiser it would be great to get the beta backports approved (https://hackmd.io/dHM5sW8oT0qhSMDAZjj4AQ?view#Beta-nominations) in some ad-hoc process; I think all three are pretty important for release. I would rather not do so unilaterally early next week.
though notably Prevent caching normalization results with a cycle #80246 is not yet approved
Wait I don’t understand: these are to get into the next beta? How many days after the stable release does that go out?
but I am less worried about it, as the bug it fixes appears to be error -> hang, not working code
no, these are for the release in 7 days
Oh I forgot release timing ; I had thought it was tomorrow
Ok. I’ll try to look at it later
thanks!
#80132 and #80135 look great to me to backport.
I'm a bit concerned that #80246 hasn't landed on nightly yet.
#80246 is a breaking change if it doesn't land in the next stable.
To clarify, do you mean that #80246 reverts a breaking change and needs to be backported to beta to resolve that?
No, #80246 reverts a change that incorrectly allowed more code to compile.
I'm happy to vote on backports.
I'll just set up the regular voting messages so people can do so async
Revert change to trait evaluation order #80132
Don't allow const to begin a nonterminal #80135
Prevent caching normalization results with a cycle #80246
I suspect @nikomatsakis won't be around to review #80246 so somebody else looking through it and r+ing it would be good.
The PR doesn't look wrong to me, but I also am not super familiar with the area this pr touches.
Just to be fully transparent, my own vote is to :back: all of them.
Ok, I'm going to r+ #80246 because I want at least some amount of testing on nightly - @bjorn3 I'm going to not apply your suggestions but would be happy to r+ a followup PR
when is the beta branch btw? I'm always confused applying beta-nominated near releases since it's unclear which beta I mean
I wish I could say '1.50-nominated' or something
It has long been my desire to switch to a version number based nomination and regression system too.
Beta branches whenever the 1.51 version bump PR merges (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/80366)
All current beta backports are hence for 1.50
er, for 1.49 beta
Thanks, I'll wait to nominate until 80366 merges then
Please indicate clearly on PR which version you're nominating for as well (just a comment is fine). Ideally, waiting a week or so would be great to avoid any confusion.
can do, this isn't urgent
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/80368 fixes a regression in 1.50 I'd prefer not to hit stable
beta-accepted all 3 of these backports per voting above, will do the actual backport this weekend or as part of promotion on Monday
I removed my own :stop_sign: votes from above, but you're still encouraged to vote/veto if you have concerns.
Thanks @nagisa and @simulacrum for taking care of all this on such short notice!
